meanings.definition: The liquid fat and juices that come out of meat during cooking.
meanings.sent1: The drippings from the roast chicken made the gravy flavorful.
meanings.sent2: Be careful not to spill the drippings from the pan.
meanings.sent3: The cat licked up the drippings from the steak, thinking it was a special treat.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like the drippings of a candle, slowly melting away any doubts.
meanings.sent5: The drippings sizzled in the hot pan, releasing a mouth-watering aroma.

meanings.definition: Drops of liquid that fall slowly from something.
meanings.sent1: The tree branches were covered in rain drippings after the storm.
meanings.sent2: I could hear the drippings of water from the leaky faucet.
meanings.sent3: The slow drippings of honey from the jar were mesmerizing to watch.
meanings.sent4: Her tears fell like gentle drippings, one by one, onto the paper.
meanings.sent5: The cave echoed with the constant drippings of water from the stalactites.
